hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.5 standard deviations from its 60-day mean, a mean reversion trade in the opposite direction will generate positive risk-adjusted returns within 5 trading days, provided the overall market regime is NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain a long-term equilibrium relationship as the two largest crypto assets. During NEUTRAL regimes, speculative flows are reduced, allowing fundamental cointegration to dominate. Extreme deviations are likely driven by temporary sentiment rather than structural changes.
entry_conditions: Calculate daily BTC/ETH price ratio (BTC_price / ETH_price)
Compute 60-day rolling mean and 20-day rolling standard deviation of the ratio
Enter short BTC/long ETH when z-score ≥ +2.5
Enter long BTC/short ETH when z-score ≤ -2.5
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades hit the ±3.5 stop loss before the ±1.0 take profit or 5-day time exit, indicating the relationship has broken down or volatility regime has changed.
